page.title: 04Wallaston Farm Part 1
page.content: Wallaston is a 220 acre dairy farm.It has 152 milking cows, 100 sheep, 60 cattle and 2 horses.The horses are show horses and used for hunting.Twice a day all 152 fresian cows are milked in a modern milking parlour,taking about two and a half hours,by just one cowman.When the farmers wife came to the farm about 15 years ago only 30 cows were milked,taking the same time as today.The milk from cow to tanker does not come into contact with the air as it travels through pipes to the cooled tank and pumped into a tanker which comes round the farms of the area each day and transports the milk to the Milk Marketing Board depot at Whitland.All kinds of machinery such as tractors,trailers,balers,muck spreaders and mowing machines to produce food for the cows such as silage and corn,are to be seen.
